Description of incident: Online attackers were able to access the usernames, email addresses, session tokens, and encrypted passwords of 250,000 users.  Twitter notified affected users and told them to create a new password.  Anyone who used the same password and username or email combination for other sites is encouraged to change the password on other sites as well.UPDATE (03/11/2013): Facebook, Microsoft, and Apple were all affected by a similar breach around the same time.
